learning_outcomes.description: Solve linear systems of ODEs and to be able to interpret their behaviour in the phase plane.
Find equilibrium solutions to nonlinear systems of ODEs and analyse their stability characteristics.
Use the Laplace Transform to solve linear ODEs and systems of ODEs with continuous and discontinuous forcing.
Use the software package Mathematica to solve systems of differential equations and plot the solutions.

Use the methods described above to analyse systems from Biology, Chemistry, Physics and Engineering (mass spring systems, mixing problems, simple electrical circuit systems, simple chemical rate equations and simple predator prey systems).

assessments.task_description: The assignments will be comprised of problems derived from the lectures and tutorials, and can be downloaded from the Blackboard website. You need to prepare your assignments as a single PDF file, either by typing them or scanning them. Your answers to the questions should be submitted electronically through Blackboard. Assignments are equally weighted.
assessments.submission_guidelines: All assessment items should be submitted electronically though Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: The final examination in this course will be held during the end-of-semester examination period. It will be an in-person exam held on campus.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.topic:
ODEs and Laplace transform

3 Lectures a week. Lectures will be on campus.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05

learning_activities.topic:
Problem Solving

One Tutorial per week (from Week 2), in which a tutor demonstrates solutions of selected problems and is available to answer questions about the tutorial sheets and assignment problems. Students work on solving problems and understanding course material, and are able to ask questions.
